metadata.Title: CVE-2018-6188 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
django.contrib.auth.forms.AuthenticationForm in Django 2.0 before 2.0.2, and 1.11.8 and 1.11.9, allows remote attackers to obtain potentially sensitive information by leveraging data exposure from the confirm_login_allowed() method, as demonstrated by discovering whether a user account is inactive.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-6188` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-django - 1.6.11
No subscription required

notes.Note: ratliff> Upstream notes that 1.8, 1.9, and 1.10 are unaffected

criterions.comment: python-django package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.6.11').
